item.title: Attention Budgets
item.description:
Treat attention like cash. Spend it once, spend it well.

If a task costs more attention than it returns, cut it or simplify it.

Small boundaries beat grand plans.

item.title: Daily Notes: A Minimal Ritual
item.description:
I keep a daily note. It starts as a timestamp and a blank line. The ritual is simple: capture what happened, what matters, what to carry forward.

Most days it’s small: a meeting outcome, a line of code, a phrase that sparks something.

The note isn’t for productivity. It’s a tiny archive of attention. And attention is the one resource that cannot be reclaimed.

Try it for a week. You might be surprised by what you remember.

item.title: The Handoff Checklist
item.description:
Write the note, then walk away. If it still matters tomorrow, it deserves the next pass.

Ship the smallest useful cut. Let real use decide what grows next.

Logs are for the future you. Tell the story so you can fix it fast.
